lexUnit.name: star_(in).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a principal role in a film, play, etc.

sentence.text: A self-confessed alcoholic , equally at home on stage and screen , he is starring in two top box office films .
Paul Newman stars in the story of Israel 's birth , Exodus .
Flowered Up 's co-manager Terry stars in Rude Boy as a wayward yoof put on the straight and narrow by Joe .
And this week Patrick Bergin stars in a new TV series -- as a victim .
IT WAS a Hollywood dream come true for beautiful English actress Lysette Anthony when she was asked to star in Woody Allen 's latest movie .
She 's currently starring in The Cemetery Club at the Wyvern Theatre in Swindon , the penultimate stop on her first British theatre tour .
ACTRESS Lysette Anthony is to star in a Basic Instinct-style thriller .
Mr Branagh will be starring in Hamlet at the Barbican from December 18 to May 1 .
Next week Miss Horrocks stars in a new BBC 2 comedy , Absolutely Famous , with Joanna Lumley , Jennifer Saunders , June Whitfield and Julia Sawalha .
She is , nonetheless , scheduled to star in the Los Angeles production of Phantom this year .
Singer Carole Lore will star alongside Bronson in the film .
He would have been the first non-Scandinavian to star in a Bergman film , an honour which went eventually to the more laid-back Elliott Gould .
Gary had taken time off from Edinburgh Playhouse where he was starring in the musical , Me and My Girl .
Harrison Ford stars as a former CIA man lured back into the fray after he becomes the target of the IRA .
Rosemarie Ford is also superfit as she dashes regularly between London and Bristol , where she is starring as Grizabella in ` Cats " .
Brad Pitt stars as Johnny , a hipster idiot hung up on Fifties Kitsch who wanders incongruently through a contemporary bombscape filled with symbolic rubble and fetishised meaninglessness .
Woody Allen wrote and directed this comedy in which he stars as New Yorker Isaac Davis who is in love with his city but disgruntled with his job as a TV comedy writer .
Continuing the action theme , Bruce Willis stars as tough cop Jon McClane in the double-tape set of Die Hard 1 and 2 .
Making her debut at the Royal National Theatre in February , Frances Barber stars as a hotel manageress in Richard Eyre 's revival of the Tennessee Williams classic , The Night Of The Iguana .
Now it 's the turn of Tom Cruise who stars as Ivy League hotshot lawyer Mitch McDeere in Sydney Pollack 's adaptation of the John Grisham bestseller The Firm .
The singer will star as a hot-dog salesman in Full Stretch , a new pop/comedy series now being secretly filmed in London .
FIERY actress Tatum O'Neal is to star as a killer in her first TV series since splitting with tennis ace John McEnroe .
The singer , starring in the West End production of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat , sued the magazine for insinuating that he was homosexual , and a hypocrite for denying it .
